name: Reference - CAR-2021-01-007: Detecting Tampering of Windows Defender Command Prompt - MITRE
x_kb_abstract: In an attempt to avoid detection after compromising a machine, threat actors often try to disable Windows Defender. This is often done using “sc” [service control], a legitimate tool provided by Microsoft for managing services. This action interferes with event detection and may lead to a security event going undetected, thereby potentially leading to further compromise of the network.
x_kb_reference_title: CAR-2021-01-007: Detecting Tampering of Windows Defender Command Prompt
